DOC.HEADLINE: Top German court suspends ratification of EU's Lisbon Treaty

TEXT.P: Germany's top court said Tuesday additional national legislation was needed before the EU's Lisbon Treaty could be ratified, further delaying its adoption across the 27-member bloc.

"The ratification document of the Federal Republic of Germany may not be adopted until the sufficient legal groundwork for parliamentary participation as foreseen in the constitution has been laid," the Federal Constitutional Court said.
